source.evidence_span: A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.
source.testimony_span: as long as Tenma Taro exists
source.explanation: The witness implies that Tenma Taro still exists. However, the statue was already stolen based on a thief's token.

gold.testimony: I'm positive it was Juniper because she was wearing the costume that she had made! [caption] The photo shows the back of a figure in a plain blue costume.

testimony.testimony: I'm positive it was Juniper because she was wearing the costume that she had made! [caption] The photo shows the back of a figure in a plain blue costume.

source.evidence_span: It has a glowing star pattern.
testimony_span: I'm positive it was Juniper because she was wearing the costume that she had made
The photo shows the back of a figure in a plain blue costume.
source.explanation: The defendant's costume should have a glowing star pattern, not plain.

gold.testimony: I didn't talk to anyone until the final bell. I'd been meditating alone at the archery range.

testimony.testimony: Oh, let me add I never went to the art room. There was no reason for me to be there.

gold.testimony: I was watching her from a vantage point between the stage and the maintenance area.

testimony.testimony: I was watching her from a vantage point between the stage and the maintenance area.

source.evidence_span: There is a tall construction screen between the stage and the vantange point near the maintenance area.
testimony_span: That's when I saw Juniper dragging a large mat from behind the stage.
I was watching her from a vantage point between the stage and the maintenance area.
source.explanation: Since there is a construction screen, the witness could not have seen behind the stage from the vantage point.

gold.testimony: But when I said I would protect Juniper, I meant it because it's the humane thing to do.

testimony.testimony: Juniper confessed to the murder and asked that I get her declared innocent in court.

gold.testimony: Mommy Metis fell down near the round window on the workbench side of the room!

testimony.testimony: Mommy Metis fell down near the round window on the workbench side of the room!

source.testimony_span: Mommy Metis fell down near the round window on the workbench side of the room!

gold.testimony: Three prints were on the lighter: the thumb, index, and middle fingers of a right hand!

testimony.testimony: What we DO have is proof that Athena Cykes is the culprit: this lighter with her prints on it!

gold.testimony: What reason would the phantom have to be afraid of the moon rock?! None at all!

testimony.testimony: I felt fear when I thought about the moon rock because it reminded me of the phantom.

gold.testimony: I saw the killer whale bite the victim to death with its huge mouth and deadly teeth!

testimony.testimony: I saw the killer whale bite the victim to death with its huge mouth and deadly teeth!

evidence_span: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body.

source.explanation: If the victim is bitten to death, he would not have died from brain contusion or blunt force trauma.

gold.testimony: At about 10:10 AM, I was in the staff room.

testimony.testimony: At about 10:10 AM, I was in the staff room.

evidence_span: Apparently belongs to Rimes. It was accidently switched with Pearls's calendar around 10:10 AM.
source.testimony_span: At about 10:10 AM, I was in the staff room.
source.explanation: According to Pearl, she ran into the witness at the prep room at 10:10 and swapped the calendar accordingly. This means the witness was not in the staff room at that time.
source.context_span:
Pearl:
Maybe my calendar and Mr. Marlon's got mixed up?
Phoenix:
Pearls, about what time did you run into Mr. Rimes?
Pearl:
I think it was about 10:15 when he had the info desk announce that I was lost... So I must have first gone into the prep room at about 10:10.

gold.testimony: If there were no water in the pool, the orca might die.

testimony.testimony: The pool water would never be drained unless the pool was being cleaned.

gold.testimony: Orla killed the captain by bashin' him thirty feet high and makin' him slam into the water!

testimony.testimony: Orla killed the captain by bashin' him thirty feet high and makin' him slam into the water!

source.evidence_span: Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Thought to be from 65-ft fall into pool.
source.testimony_span: Orla killed the captain by bashin' him thirty feet high and makin' him slam into the water!
source.explanation: The victim fell to death from 65 ft, not 30 ft.

gold.testimony: The defendant's prints were on the tape. I guess she must've moved it during the show.

gold.testimony: That's right. It's a very dangerous trick, so I had to make sure we were prepared for it.

source.explanation: Not only was it empty, but dust lines the inside of the pail.

source.explanation: Since the sanctum was isolated by the ritual curtain, the witness couldn't have seen the rite with his binoculars.

gold.testimony: The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night.

testimony.testimony: I saw their shadowy silhouettes, projected against the ritual curtain!

gold.testimony: It's not like I can fly through the air, either!

testimony.testimony: Besides, it woulda been impossible to get there in the first place!

gold.testimony: He was an illegal immigrant, so we don't know his real name.

Rayfa:
All members of the Khura'inist clergy have such marks upon them.

gold.testimony: I would describe the noise as a terrible crash. Poor Zeh'lot... It must have felt so heavy.

source.explanation: A loud noise would not have automatically led the witness to conclude the victim was crushed to death, thus feeling heavy.

gold.testimony: She is a spirit medium who knows Lady Kee'ra's true name, so she could have done it.

testimony.testimony: She is a spirit medium who knows Lady Kee'ra's true name, so she could have done it.

evidence_span: The priestess acting as Lady Kee'ra's representative must know her name and have seen her face.
source.testimony_span: She is a spirit medium who knows Lady Kee'ra's true name, so she could have done it.
source.explanation: One not only needs to know the name of the Lady Kee'ra, but also to have seen her face. Lady Kee'ra is wearing a mask in the tome, so Acolyte Fey could not have seen Lady Kee'ra's face from the tome.

gold.testimony: As for the relic at the center of this dispute, he likely stole it from the Atishon residence.

testimony.testimony: As for the relic at the center of this dispute, he likely stole it from the Atishon residence.

source.evidence_span: it was sent from Buff to "PAW-711@nmail" as a reply to an earlier email concerning his research into the Founder's Orb
source.testimony_span: he likely stole it from the Atishon residence
source.explanation: "PAW" in the email likely stands for Paul Atishon-Wimperson, the plaintiff. This suggests that the plaintiff is aware of of the defendant's research into the artifact. Therefore, the defendant could not have stolen the artifact from the plaintiff's residence.

gold.testimony: I had no idea Dr. Buff was dead. That's why I didn't call the police.
I had no idea Dr. Buff was dead. That's why I didn't call the police.

testimony.testimony: I had no idea Dr. Buff was dead. That's why I didn't call the police.

evidence_span: The victim is lying in the study next to floor-to-ceiling windows with clear glass.
There is a tree outside the large floor-to-ceiling window.
testimony_span: I was under this tree when I saw Mr. Are'bal.
I had no idea Dr. Buff was dead.
source.explanation: Since there is a floor-to-ceiling window separating the tree outside and the study inside, the witness could have seen the victim and known he was dead.

gold.testimony: I didn't have eyes on the ground, as I'd already mounted my siege defense, but...

testimony.testimony: The doctor was standing in front of the bookshelves, absorbed in a book.

source.explanation: The doctor requires the glasses to read anything. Since the glasses were found on his desk, he must have been reading at the desk, not the bookshelves..

gold.testimony: The possibility of a third party being there in the tomb is probably nonexistent.

testimony.testimony: The next thing I knew, I was standing there with a bloody knife in my hand.

gold.testimony: I had been gazing upon the courtyard since about 2, but father was the only one I saw.

gold.testimony: And that estimated time of death is correct. There's no way it could be wrong.

testimony.testimony: The victim could not have been killed before the reception.

source.explanation: candelabra
source.context_span:
Nichody:
...Very well. This is what I heard directly from Master Sorin himself. As you surmised, Master Sorin was stabbed by Gloomsbury on the day of the murder. It happened after the first wedding reception. The happy couple was in the reception hall when, suddenly, Gloomsbury appeared... He attacked Miss Ellen and tried to take her away. Master Sorin went to stop him, and found himself in a struggle with Gloomsbury. That is when Master Sorin was stabbed with the candelabra, he said.

gold.testimony: In the hold, I hid the still-warm body in the spare Pegabull lantern.

testimony.testimony: In the hold, I hid the still-warm body in the spare Pegabull lantern.

source.evidence_span: There's a bloodstain on the inside wheel handle, as if somebody gripped it with a bloody hand.
source.testimony_span: I hid the still-warm body in the spare Pegabull lantern
source.explanation: The bloodstain on the inside wheel handle suggests the person put inside was still alive.

gold.testimony: I was always in the company of others. I didn't have the opportunity to murder Gloomsbury.

testimony.testimony: I was always in the company of others. I didn't have the opportunity to murder Gloomsbury.

source.evidence_span: Much of the reception hall is obscured by thick fog.
source.testimony_span: I was always in the company of others. I didn't have the opportunity to murder Gloomsbury.
source.explanation: Even if the witness was in the company of others, he would have the opportunity to commit murder given the thick fog.
